CN.content:

Sure, my apologies. The relevant entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the paragraph are:

Note that "DTDPP" is the only material name mentioned in the paragraph.

1. 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 is a chemical structure that represents a molecule with a specific arrangement of atoms. It is a property value because it describes a specific chemical entity with a particular set of chemical properties.
2. 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione (DTDPP) is also a chemical structure that represents a molecule with a specific arrangement of atoms. It is a property value because it describes a specific chemical entity with a particular set of chemical properties.

In this paragraph, the author is discussing the potential of DTDPP as a building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. The mention of 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 is likely a reference to a specific isomer or variant of DTDPP that was studied in the research being discussed.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to the Value of Material Property in the given paragraph:

The entity "3,6-dithien-2-yl-2" is not relevant to the concept of Value of Material Property, as it does not provide any information about the physical or chemical properties of the material. It is merely a synonym for DTDPP, which is the main material being discussed in the paragraph. Therefore, the updated list only includes DTDPP as the relevant entity for the concept of Value of Material Property.
